titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller University records, Scientific Reports of the Laboratories to the Corporation and to the Board of Scientific Directors
A Guide to the Rockefeller University records, Scientific Reports of the Laboratories to the Corporation and to the Board of Scientific Directors FA145

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-03-07 00:12:05 -0500.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller University records, Scientific Reports of the Laboratories to the Corporation and to the Board of Scientific Directors
did.physdesc: 24 document boxes consisting of 42 volumes and several additional reports.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Consists of reports on work done in the laboratories, hospital, Department of Animal and Plant Pathology; under grants to Babies' Hospital; War Demonstration Hospital. Reports made to the Scientific Directors at April or May meetings (early reports made more frequently) and to the Corporation at meetings held in October. Included as addenda are some special reports and copies of letters.
Some special reports of the Director of the Institute to the Corporation are included.
1955 volume is incomplete.

Starting v. 15 (1926/1927) reports to the Corporation are topical narratives on selected work; with v. 24 (1935/1936) the reports to the Corporation consists of fully treated selected subjects. With v. 39 (1950/1951) presentation of reports to the Scientific Directors follows new organization of divisions in the Departments and reflects unification of Princeton and New York City laboratories. The reports to the Corporation are from the Directors and are in skeletal form giving an overall picture of investigations in progress.

No scientific reports were made to the Corporation in v. 23 (1934/1935) or in v. 41 (1953) because of the change in the Directorship of the Institute in those years. Volume 42 (1953/1954) is a general scientific report to the Board of Trustees reflecting the change in organization. 1955 was never presented and is incomplete.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: A complete set of all 42 volumes of scientific reports is also available at the Campus Office of the Rockefeller University Archives.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Types of records include: reports.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addenda includes: copies of letters of appreciation of contributions and work of The Rockefeller Institute.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Addendum: (1) Letter from Louise Pearce on African Expedition (2) Special report from Simon Flexner and one from A. E. Cohn on trip abroad in relation to special Institute problems in physiology and pharmacology. Positions offered to Hoguchi, Van Slyke, Swift and Blake.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Report to the Corporation includes a preamble "Teaching at the Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research" with an appendix listing University Positions held by Former Staff Members at RIMR and listing of Visiting Investigators. Also includes a new form of report from the Laboratories to the Corporation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sequence of reports varies from earlier years in accord with revised classifications also followed in Descriptive pamphlet. Report to Corporation is no longer a brief description, but rather a complete listing of work done under various sections.
Includes memorandum prepared by Herbert Gasser for John D. Rockefeller, Jr. called "Medical Research; a Look Ahead at the RIMR.
